Most Illustrious Sir

The two letters of Your Lordship dated the 28th and 30th of last month have been presented to the government, and the matter was well understood, approving the measures taken by Your Lordship.

And regarding the last part of your letter, in which you speak of the woman indicated as dangerous to the tranquility of this department, since she in some way facilitated the enemy's entry: the government orders that, after Your Lordship

The enclosed letter, I beg Your Lordship

God keep Your Lordship War Affairs Secretariat in Caçapava, May 14, 1840 Most Illustrious Sir Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães. Serafim Joaquim de Alencastre

Letter from the Most Excellent, May 14, received on the 28th of the same [month], regarding the parts I gave about the enemy, and about the woman indicated as an enemy, etc., etc.
